entry.title: The Absolute Best Easter Candy
entry.summary:
Our good friend the Easter Bunny wants to know: Are you counting down the days until Easter? We definitely are! Easter is creeping up fast, and if there’s one thing you don’t want to be unprepared for, it’s that crazy last minute Easter candy shopping.

More
entry.content:
Our good friend the Easter Bunny wants to know: Are you counting down the days until Easter? We definitely are!

Easter is creeping up fast, and if there’s one thing you don’t want to be unprepared for, it’s that crazy last minute Easter candy shopping. Why go to a busy store and fight over the last bag of pretty pastel-coloured Easter candy when you can order everything you need to please your family and friends (and yourself!) right here online? (We promise we won’t hold it against you if you’re ordering from the couch in your pajamas with a glass of wine. Your secret is safe with us!)

Do you want to know the secret to picking the absolute best Easter candy? It’s really simple: You need variety. Great Easter baskets never contain just one type of candy. From chocolates to hard candies, from sweet to sour, from classic candies to brand spankin’ new ones, picking a variety of Easter candy will make you everyone’s hero.

The best part about shopping online at Candy Funhouse for Easter candy is that our candy connoisseurs have made the job super easy for you. If you need some timely inspiration on what to put in Easter baskets or hide on an Easter egg hunt, read on! We’ve got the low-down on the best Easter candy guaranteed to put smiles on the faces of your loved ones:

The Best Easter Candy to Go in Your Easter Baskets

There are so many delightful candies you can include in your Easter baskets that will be sure to make your kiddos smile with delight. You can’t make a bad choice when it comes to Easter candy!

One of our favourite Easter sweets has to be the Reese’s Miniatures Peanut Butter Filled Chicks. What could be better than a Reese’s peanut butter cup? Lots of mini ones inside a festive yellow chick egg package! Everyone loves the classic peanut butter-chocolate combo that Reese’s is known for, so this Easter special is a no-brainer. You could also try the Reese’s Easter Egg, which is just as cute and delicious.

Another great candy choice for any Easter basket are lollipops, especially the rainbow ones. Not only are these tasty, but they’ll add extra visual appeal to your baskets with a colourful twist! Candy Funhouse has some great lollipop options, including the Easter Curly Swirly Lollipops and the Easter Curly Swirly Egg Lollipops. Festive and bright, they are also shaped like a bunny and an egg, the perfect symbols for springtime.

Of course, no basket could be complete without the Canadian Easter classic— Cadbury Crème Eggs! Their thick chocolate shells hide a delicious surprise—yellow and white fondant that mimics the look of a chicken egg yolk. So good!  

The Best Easter Candy for Your Easter Egg Hunt

An Easter egg hunt is usually the highlight of the day for many families, so why not “wow” your kids with not only your expert egg hiding skills, but also your amazing Easter egg candy selecting skills too?

Of course, the classic Easter candies are Cadbury Mini Eggs, Mini Whoppers Eggs, and Reese’s Pieces Eggs—all great chocolate choices that should make an appearance inside any plastic egg found on your hunt. But like we said before, variety when it comes to Easter candy makes things so much sweeter. So, mix things up on your egg hunt by also including some non-chocolate Easter candies, such as Mike and Ike Easter Treats or Sweetarts Mini Gummy Bites.

Finding candy small enough to put into Easter eggs can be tough, but luckily, you have Candy Funhouse on your side. Our team of fun-gineers recommend using a combination of Laffy Taffys (their chewy sweetness is addicting!), Hershey’s Kisses (the yellow foil ones will make you think you’ve found gold!), and pastel-coloured Salt Water Taffys (with a variety of flavours available, including Bubble Gum,  Blueberry, Laffy Taffy Banana, and even Chocolate Chip Cookie).

The Best Easter Candy to Use On Your Easter Desserts

When your family and friends gather around the dinner table to share an Easter Sunday meal, you can bet they are all wondering what’s in store for dessert. Get creative and surprise your dinner guests with an innovative and unique Easter dessert featuring special Easter candies. You’ll definitely win over the dessert-lovers around the table and make an Instagram-worthy treat at the same time!

Check out some of these desserts that you can make with our Candy Funhouse sweets and treats:

Cadbury Crème Egg Cupcakes

This recipe combines two of your favourite things: Cadbury Crème Mini Eggs and cupcakes! With this dessert, you bake the Cadbury Mini Eggs right into the cupcakes and decorate the top of the cupcakes with them too. What more could you ask for in an Easter dessert?! These cupcakes will be an instant hit with your guests.

No-Bake Chocolate Egg Nest Cookies

These are adorable! If you’re looking for something simple and easy but really tasty to make with your kids over the Easter weekend, these cookies might be the perfect option. This recipe combines chocolate chips and chow mein noodles for a “nest”-inspired base. Then you add your “eggs”—Mini Robin Eggs, Jelly Belly jelly beans, or M&Ms in any of your favourite flavours. These almost look too good to eat!

Easter Candy Kabobs

Combine your favourite Easter candies in a way you’ve never tried before: Easter Candy Kabobs. What could be more fun? This recipe is quick, easy, and kid-friendly. Plus, you can customize your Easter kabobs with any candy that you love, such as Sour Punch Twists, Warheads Chewy Bunnies, and springtime Awesome Blossom gummies. The combinations are nearly endless!

We’ve thrown so many ideas out at you that even the Easter Bunny was frantically taking notes. Trust us when we say that your loved ones are going to love any and all of these candies. So what are you waiting for? Get “cracking” now and order your Easter candy today. You won’t regret it!

In the comments below, let us know what YOUR favourite Easter sweets are. Happy Easter!
